footer.disclaimerText: This tool is provided for educational and informational purposes only. Tax calculations are estimates and may not reflect your actual tax liability. For official advice, always consult the

box1Form.hoursHelperText: Used to calculate annual income from hourly rate
box1Form.holidayAllowanceTooltip: If enabled, your gross income already includes the 8% holiday allowance. If disabled, it will be added separately.
box1Form.olderAgeTooltip: Check if you are at or above state pension age (AOW). Different tax rates and no AOW premium apply.
box1Form.ruling30Tooltip: Tax-free allowance for skilled migrants. 30% of your salary becomes tax-free. Different income thresholds apply based on category.
box1Form.socialSecurityTooltip: Include Dutch social security contributions (AOW, ANW, WLZ). Most employees pay these unless exempt.
box1Form.resetMessage: This will clear all your entered data including income, hours, and tax settings. This action cannot be undone.

box1Result.grossIncomeInfo: Your total income before any deductions.
box1Result.netIncomeInfo: Your take-home pay after all taxes and deductions.
box1Result.totalTaxInfo: Total income tax including payroll tax, social security, minus credits.
box1Result.taxableIncomeInfo: Income subject to taxation (after 30% ruling if applicable).
box1Result.payrollTaxInfo: Income tax withheld from your salary.
box1Result.socialSecurityInfo: Contributions for AOW, ANW, and WLZ.
box1Result.generalTaxCreditInfo: Algemene heffingskorting - basic tax credit for all taxpayers.

box3Result.estimatedTaxInfo: Projected Box 3 tax for the selected year using current assumptions.
box3Result.netAssetsInfo: Your savings and investments after subtracting deductible debts.
box3Result.taxableBaseInfo: Amount that remains after the tax-free allowance has been applied.
box3Result.totalAssetsInfo: Combined balances of your bank and investment accounts.
box3Result.debtsInfo: Deductible debts included in the Box 3 calculation.
box3Result.allowancesAppliedInfo: Standard tax-free allowance applied to your Box 3 assets.
box3Result.actualReturnDisclaimer: If your actual returns were lower than the fictitious returns (calculated above), you may request taxation based on actual returns from 2025 onwards.

box3Form.bankAccountsDesc: Add the balances of your Dutch checking and savings accounts on 1 January.
box3Form.investmentAccountsDesc: Include the market value of your investment or brokerage portfolios on 1 January.
box3Form.debtsDesc: List deductible debts, such as loans outstanding on 1 January.
box3Form.taxPartnerTooltip: If you have a fiscal partner, the tax-free threshold doubles.

config.title: Box 3 Tax Configuration
config.yearHelperText: Selecting a year loads its official defaults
config.assumedReturnRatesDesc: Fictitious returns set by the Dutch Tax Authority

modals.privacyIntro: Your financial data is your business.
modals.privacyText: incomeTaxNL is a privacy-focused free and open source tool to estimate Dutch Box 1 and Box 3 taxes. Any data you enter is only stored locally in your browser. All calculations run 100% locally in your browser — your personal financial data is never sent, stored, or collected by this app for any reason.
modals.privacyBullet1: No risk of leaks, hacks, or misuse: your sensitive information never leaves your device.
modals.privacyBullet2: No tracking, no uploads, no analytics: you stay in control of your data.
modals.privacyBullet3: Use incomeTaxNL with confidence for salary and capital gains calculations, knowing your privacy is protected.
modals.aboutText: incomeTaxNL helps you estimate Dutch Box 1 salary tax and Box 3 wealth tax with a privacy-first approach. All calculations run locally, so your data never leaves your browser.
modals.howToUse1: Select Box 1 or Box 3 using the toggle at the top of the calculator.
modals.howToUse2: Enter your income, savings, investments, and debts in the left-side forms.
modals.howToUse3: Open the settings gear to tweak thresholds, return assumptions, or tax year.
modals.howToUse4: Review the results panel for a breakdown of taxable bases and estimated taxes.
modals.originText: Navigating Dutch taxes used to be confusing for me. I built an elaborate spreadsheet to make sense of the rules, but it was too complex for friends and colleagues. This app is the friendlier version—same clarity, with explanations that anyone can follow.
modals.creditsText: incomeTaxNL is an open-source project created by
modals.creditsTextEnd: to help people understand Dutch taxes.
modals.feedbackThanks: Thanks to everyone who provided feedback to improve this tool.
modals.termsAcceptanceText: By using incomeTaxNL, you agree to these Terms of Use. If you do not agree, please discontinue use of this tool immediately.
modals.termsEducationalText: incomeTaxNL is provided solely for educational and informational purposes. It is designed to help users understand and estimate Dutch income tax calculations. This tool does NOT constitute professional tax advice, legal advice, or financial planning services.
modals.termsWarrantyText: All calculations and information are provided "as is" without any warranty of accuracy, completeness, or fitness for a particular purpose. Tax laws, rates, and regulations may change, and this tool may not reflect the most current information. Users are responsible for verifying all results with official sources.
modals.termsLiabilityText: The creator and contributors of incomeTaxNL shall not be liable for any damages, losses, or tax liabilities arising from the use or misuse of this tool. Users assume all risks associated with using the estimates provided.
modals.termsConsultationText: For official tax calculations, filing, or advice, users must consult the
modals.termsConsultationEnd: (Dutch Tax and Customs Administration) or a qualified tax professional.
modals.termsPrivacyText: All data entered into incomeTaxNL is stored locally in your browser and never transmitted to any server. We do not collect, store, or share your personal or financial information. See our Privacy Policy for more details.
modals.termsOpenSourceText: incomeTaxNL is open source software available on
modals.termsOpenSourceEnd: . You may use, modify, and distribute it according to the terms of its license.
modals.termsChangesText: These terms may be updated from time to time. Continued use of incomeTaxNL after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised terms.
modals.termsContactText: For questions or concerns, please contact us via

explanation.box1Hint: How is your income tax calculated?
explanation.box3Hint: How is your wealth tax calculated?
explanation.exampleNoteBox1: The following example uses a yearly salary of
explanation.exampleNoteBox1End: Enter your income above to see your personalized calculation.
explanation.exampleNoteBox3InInvestments: in investments. Enter your assets above to see your personalized calculation.
explanation.understandingBox1Text: In the Netherlands, income from employment is taxed under Box 1. The calculation starts with your gross annual income of
explanation.understandingBox1TextEnd: This is your total salary before any taxes or deductions are applied.
explanation.holidayAllowanceText: Dutch employees typically receive an 8% holiday allowance (vakantiegeld) on top of their base salary.
explanation.ruling30Text: With the 30% ruling for highly skilled migrants,
explanation.ruling30TextEnd: of your income is tax-free. This significantly reduces your taxable base and is one of the most valuable tax benefits available to expats in the Netherlands.
explanation.taxableIncomeText: After applying any exemptions, your taxable income is
explanation.taxableIncomeTextEnd: This is the amount on which the Dutch tax authority (Belastingdienst) calculates your income tax.
explanation.taxBracketsText: The Netherlands uses a progressive tax system with two main brackets: income up to approximately 75,000 euros is taxed at 36.97%, while income above this threshold is taxed at 49.5%. Based on your taxable income, the payroll tax (loonheffing) amounts to
explanation.socialSecurityTextEnd: towards Dutch social security programs, including AOW (state pension), ANW (survivor benefits), and WLZ (long-term care). These contributions provide essential social protections.
explanation.taxCreditsText: The Dutch tax system provides valuable credits that directly reduce your tax liability. You receive a general tax credit (algemene heffingskorting) of
explanation.taxCreditsLabourText: and a labour tax credit (arbeidskorting) of
explanation.takeHomeText: After subtracting taxes and adding back your credits, your net annual income is
explanation.effectiveRateTextEnd: which represents the actual percentage of your gross income that goes to taxes after all credits are applied.
explanation.understandingBox3Text: In the Netherlands, wealth from savings and investments is taxed under Box 3. Unlike income tax, Box 3 does not tax your actual returns. Instead, the tax authority assumes a fictional return on your assets and taxes that amount.
explanation.totalAssetsText: Your Box 3 assets are measured as of January 1st of the tax year.
explanation.totalAssetsInInvestments: in investments, bringing the total to
explanation.taxFreeAllowanceText: Not all your wealth is taxed. In 2025, the first
explanation.taxFreeAllowanceTextEnd: of your assets is exempt from Box 3 tax.
explanation.taxFreeAllowancePartnerText: Since you have a tax partner, this allowance is shared between you, potentially doubling the household exemption.
explanation.taxableCapitalText: After subtracting the tax-free allowance from your net assets, your taxable capital (grondslag sparen en beleggen) is
explanation.taxableCapitalTextEnd: This is the base amount used to calculate your fictional return.
explanation.fictitiousReturnText: The Dutch tax authority calculates a fictitious return based on the composition of your assets. Savings typically have a lower assumed return rate than investments. For your asset mix, the calculated fictitious return is
explanation.fictitiousReturnTextEnd: per year. This is not your actual return, it is what the government assumes you earned.
explanation.box3TaxRateText: is taxed at a flat rate of
explanation.box3TaxResultText: This results in a Box 3 tax of
explanation.box3TaxNote: Note: If your actual investment returns were lower than the assumed (fictitious) return, you may be paying tax on income you did not actually receive. Recent court rulings have challenged this system, and reforms are expected in coming years.
